column3: At some point in life the world's beauty becomes enough. You don't need to photograph, paint or even remember it. It is enough.
It would be difficult for me not to conclude that the most perfect type of masculine beauty is Satan, as portrayed by Milton.
In marriage do thou be wise: prefer the person before money, virtue before beauty, the mind before the body; then thou hast a wife, a friend, a companion, a second self.
Obscenity, which is ever blasphemy against the divine beauty in life, is a monster for which the corruption of society forever brings forth new food, which it devours in secret.
Those who find beauty in all of nature will find themselves at one with the secrets of life itself.
Beauty is not something you can count on. Usually, when people say you are beautiful, it is when there is a harmony between the inside and the outside.

I would like to say to people, open your eyes and find beauty where you normally don't expect it.
I really admire a woman for her intelligence, her personality. Beauty is not enough.

My idea of beauty is somebody that doesn't have to try too much, someone who is effortless and fresh.
There is beauty when something works and it works intuitively.

I believe love at first sight is possible. Centuries of literature and art and beauty has been dedicated to that idea, so who am I to argue, even if I've never experienced it?
